Gratitude is Powerful—Do Not Yield to Heaviness! with Allen Jackson

Somewhere along the line we have landed on a new beach head—and it requires a new authority. We need to return to the WORD of God. We don’t need to be discouraged or live as slaves—we are free! Allen Jackson shares a powerful word today, and it’s just in time. This is a powerful interview with a powerful voice in the culture!

Continue reading →

A Shaking in the Church: We are NOT Powerless with Allen Jackson

Discouraged? Isolated? You’re not alone! With a casual glance at American history, there’s no explanation for the blessing that has been on our nation apart from God’s grace and mercy! But what has the Church done in response? Today, Allen Jackson joins me to talk about this important topic. Be encouraged! God is at work.

Continue reading →

Progressivism in the Church

Does the Church have a responsibility to vote a “certain way” when it comes to the issue of abortion? What about women pastors? What about the fear of speaking out? The Bible is not silent on these issues, and so we should not be silent, either. Our confidence is not well-placed in men or government—it is well-placed in the Lord!

One Year of Two Weeks to Flatten the Curve

I’m acknowledging a sad anniversary today and answering your questions! Kristin asks: “How can I get “off the bench” if I’m a homeschooling mom of three?” I’m answering this and several other questions today. Listen in and be encouraged! Your voice matters! Continue reading →

What Does it Mean to Be a Strong Woman? With Sarah Stonestreet and Erin Kunkle Part 2

What does it mean to be a strong woman? What messages should we be sending our daughters about what it looks like to be full of “grace and grit” in the culture right now? Sarah Stonestreet and Erin Kunkle, hosts of the “Strong Women Podcast” join me today to talk about their experience and what they hope to pass on to their own daughters.
